How Malware Authors Are Incorporating LLMs to Evade Detection

Tech 5 min read

The article discusses how malware developers are increasingly leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance the sophistication and stealthiness of their malicious software. By using LLMs, these cybercriminals are able to generate more realistic and convincing phishing messages, automate the creation of varied attack scripts, and even adapt their tactics in real-time to avoid detection by security systems. "Shai-Hulud" Worm Compromises npm Ecosystem in Supply Chain Attack (Updated November 26)

AI 5 min read

In a concerning development for the software development community, the "Shai-Hulud" worm has been identified as a major threat to the npm ecosystem through a sophisticated supply chain attack. The worm infiltrates npm packages, which are widely used for JavaScript applications, thereby compromising the security of numerous projects and their users worldwide.
